precontext: John and Mary had planned this trip for months. They both needed time away from the hustle of the city. After packing their bags, they were finally on their way.
sentence: The couple went to their reservation.
meanings_considered: a district that is reserved for particular purpose
the act of reserving (a place or passage) or engaging the services of (a person or group)
explanation:
• The precontext mentions John and Mary planning a trip to escape city life, making a "reservation" as a geographical location (meaning 1) highly plausible.  
• "Reservation" as the act of reserving a place or service (meaning 2) does not fit, as there is no mention of dining, lodging, or booking a service.  
• The phrase "went to their reservation" logically refers to a physical location (a tribal or geographic area), not an act of booking.
clear_meaning_text: a district that is reserved for particular purpose
